reviewText: This started out cheesy. Probably one of the lamest movies ive seen and not particularly in a 'good way'...though it had its moments. It seemed like one big excuse to see women naked and the acting was average at best. Its about some students at an all girls private school called Cherryvale Academy. Theres 2 girls that want the same guy whos also a student at a nearby Academy for Men. Also some kind of relationship between one of the girls and that guy. In between all this the guys start dressing up like women to get into the girls dorms to pull pranks on them.  As the movie went on it got a little bit better and there were some genuinely funny scenes in it 'like the car scene' but nothing spectacular. I also liked some parts of it and was able to relate to some of the things that went on and laughed to myself. I guess you could call this a 'sex or romantic comedy'. I call it that but also just an excuse to see hot girls naked. 2.5- 3

reviewText: I have fond memories of being a horny 13 year old and catching Private School on cable back in the mid-80's and it had always been a movie I longed to see have a DVD release. Well...that day has finally arrived and I'm here to tell you that I must have been dumb as a rock at 13 cuz Private School might be one of the worst pieces of drek to crawl out of the 80's teen sex comedy toilet you'll ever see...and it's wonderful. See, movies can sometimes be an entirely subjective thing if you have memories attatched to them. Viewing this film nearly 25 years later I was instantly transported back to my teenage years and I spent more time reminiscing about the 80's, my first crush, the kids I hung out with, etc. than paying attention to the flick. That's not a bad thing really. The script is atrocious, the actors are painfully unfunny (especially the guy who plays Bubba who I recall stinking up a lot of these teen movies) and the cheese-ometer gets cranked up a few notches when a song sung by Phoebe Cates plays over a montage that makes Baywatch look classy.Which brings me to Phoebe Cates...the sole reason this film even exists. Has there ever been another actress whose good looks radiate charisma when she herself is'nt really doing much of anything? Don't get me wrong she turned out to be a fine actress and her previous film "Fast Times At Ridgemont High" is about a zillion times better than Private School but truth is Phoebe Cates might have the most beautiful face ever committed to film (which may explain why the Phoebe-Cult continued to this day).And yet....it's Betsy Russelll who delivers the goods, who actually provides Private School with it's truly sexy moments. Just watch the scene where she tries to seduce Matthew Modine by flaunting her perfectly toned legs in his face and tell me that she might not be the queen seductress of all time.So if you've never seen this movie (and you're under 30) you'll probably wonder what all the fuss was about but if you remember 1983 and you remember waiting on line to play Pac-Man at the arcade, chances are you love this film for reasons good taste can't explain.
summary: Truly awful film...so why the 3 stars?

reviewText: This is not some high brow art film!  Its a stupid, silly, total screwball sex comedy with a lot of hot women in skimpy outfits. It really is very stupid and sophmoric but just turn off your brain and enjoy the eye candy and you should enjoy this film.

reviewText: I'm glad this finally made it to DVD. After watching it in all of its cheesy glory, I must say, it's still good!  Ok, ok, maybe it's just because Phoebe Cates is a goddess and Betsy Russell is so freakin hot. Russell randomly prances around flailing her exposed breasts around like it's nobody's business.  In fact, just watching her top come off while horseback riding is completely off the wall, ridiculous, and awesome at the same time. Get this DVD if you like a bunch of random nudity.  If you're into the typical 80s fare like Back to School, and Fast Times then you'll dig this movie.  You can't be the type of person who cringes at cheesy, dated movies.  If anything, get it for Phoebe Cates having sex on the beach.

reviewText: The best way I can describe this movie is a combination of Porky's and Fast Times at Ridgemont High, yet nowhere near as good as either of them.  However if you were a boy anywhere near puberty in the 1980s this was one of the movies you always hoped came on cable late at night when you got to stay up late.  The script and acting are atrocious.  Even though the movie had some young stars that would go on to be relatively good actors, they were not given much to work with, even by teen sex comedy standards.  There were also some whose careers never made it out of the 1980s.  It has about every 80s movie cliche you can imagine (right down to the cheesy music montage).  The two best things about the movie Betsy Russell, and having some relatively good songs on the soundtrack.  Phoebe Cates was the big star in the movie, coming off her role in Fast times.  And although she was the "sexy one" in that movie, she plays the rather bland "good girl" in this one.  She is of course still gorgeous, and did show a little bit toward the end of the movie, but Betsy Russell is the one who amps up the sex factor here.Ultimately you know what you get with this.  It is not great by any means.  Do not expect an academy award winner, but if you fall within the demographic who remembers this movie from your youth, you can have a good laugh at how good you probably thought it was when you were young, and fondly remember ogling Betsy.
summary: Horrible and great at the same time

I finally rented it recently and the shower scene is to die for! Not enough Betsy Russel skin but everything else was sweet! Did she come out in anything else? Anyway, watch this movie if you just want to see a stupid, hot 80's movie! This is as legendary as Cheryl Smith's Cinderella, which I have yet to see again since I was a kid watching it on scrambled Cinemax.

reviewText: If you don't know how lame it is possible for a movie to be, watch this. Then you will know.This is the kind of movie that people leave off resumes and hope no-one will remember. There are occasional laughs, but most of the scene set-ups are so dopey that they pull you straight out of the movie and make you wonder what the director was thinking. The script is so bad that I guess he didn't have many options. Or maybe he got something better and then destroyed it. You won't know, and you won't care. You will just wish you had watched something else.

reviewText: I don't really have anything to add to the other reviews here, except to agree this is a bad, lame movie that is fun in spite of itself. It is primarily eye candy for guys, a hormonally-driven sex comedy that misses no chance in providing cheap thrills. Normally, unfunny comedies are painful to watch, especially when the script is as weak as this one; yet, some very good casting and a light tone buoy this film and make it rather likeable. Matthew Modine is pleasant enough and, even though I worship at the altar of Phoebe Cates, it is truly Betsy Russell who steals the show here. She is beautiful, conniving and very sexy. The DVD is bare-bones, with no bonus material, only one language option and not even any chapter selections. However, the transfer is quite good, it is presented in widescreen and the price is low, making this one to buy.

reviewText: If you liked the movie FAST TIMES AT RIDGEMONT HIGH and thought FAST TIMES was deliciously nasty, you shall definetley like PRIVATE SCHOOL too, especially since this movie is a little similar to FAST TIMES, plus PRIVATE SCHOOL has quite a few of the same co-stars that were in FAST TIMES AT RIDGEMONT HIGH as well, like Phoebe Cates and Ray Walston for instance, except PRIVATE SCHOOL is even dirtier with even more graphic nudity than FAST TIMES was, since PRIVATE SCHOOL also contains a sexy nude scene with Phoebe Cates(Chris) and Matt Modine doing hubba hubba on the beach and a girls lockerroom shower scene showing us a lot of the private school students showing us a lot of full frontal nudity.The truth is, PRIVATE SCHOOL is a tad similar to FAST TIMES AT RIDGEMONT HIGH, except PRIVATE SCHOOL is a dirty comedy flick about guys trying to score with girls living at a private school instead of immature guys and gals at a public high school like in FAST TIMES.This movie also takes me all the way back to memory lane to my childhoold days to when I was living in the Imperial Valley since I was 10 years old living in my hometown(El Centro, CA) at the time when PRIVATE SCHOOL had its theatrical release in the Summer of 1983.

reviewText: This is a classic early '80s sex comedy with some of the most gorgeous all-natural beauties of the era. Everybody knows about Phoebe Cates, but co-star (and arch-nemesis) Betsy Russell has to be one of the most beautiful women in history. It amazes me that she isn't more well-known--breathtaking, and totally unafraid of showing what God blessed her with.They just don't make them this way anymore, and that's sad: Absurdly-gratuitous nude scenes of 10 or 15 naked girls' walking around in the shower; the requisite "guy pulls off bikini top" scene; etc. etc.And beyond that, the movie is entertaining and the humor not just  totally grating (as it can be in these movies). The only thing that keeps it from getting five stars from me, ironically, is the lack of nudity in the movie's second half. The first half is just full of it, but the second doesn't do much more than tease. C'mon!
